content.title: Danny Dyer's 'Have I Got News For You' Stint Really Divided Viewers - HuffPost UK
content.desc: Following his Brexit rant earlier this year, Danny Dyer seemed like the perfect choice to guest host ‘Have I Got News For You’ - or so producers might have thought. The ‘EastEnders’ actor’s turn at the helm of the comedy panel show actually really divided viewers on Friday night. While many loved his trademark banter, others were less impressed by his presenting ability. Some branded him “wooden” as he tried to crack topical gags on the BBC show. How wooden is Danny Dyer - Dier #hignfy — Paul (@Porl1878) December 7, 2018 I didn’t think an Eastenders actor could get any more wooden, but Dann...

content.title: Danny Dyer hosts Have I Got News for You, review: guest host hits his stride with nimble wit and salty quips - The Telegraph
content.desc: “I forgot how highbrow this f***ing show is.” So said guest host Danny Dyer on Have I Got News For You(BBC One).The EastEnders star’s industrial language and nimble natural wit made for a uproarious installment of the hoary old satirical quiz. Roguish Cockney thesp Dyer has enjoyed a gratifying career turnaround in recent years, transforming himself from bargain-bin action hero to televisual treasure by virtue of his award-winning, soap-salvaging role as Queen Vic landlord Mick Carter and cockle-warming discovery of his royal roots on Who Do You Think You Are? Dyer also has new-found form f...

content.title: Love Island winners Dani Dyer and Jack Fincham split after six months - The Independent
content.desc: Dani Dyer and Jack Fincham have announced their separation just over four months after winning Love Island 2018. After a whirlwind six-month relationship, Dyer revealed the news in a statement that she shared on her Instagram story. “Jack and I have sadly decided to part ways,” she wrote. - Read more Why girls should be able to watch ‘Love Island’ and still be feminists “It’s been an incredible six months, and we will always have a place in our hearts for each other, but sadly we’ve come to the realisation that it’s not meant to be long term. “We both plan to stay friends. content.title: Dani Dyer And Jack Fincham Split Four Months After Winning Love Island - HuffPost UK
content.desc: Dani Dyer and Jack Fincham have split four months after being crowned winners of Love Island. The pair, who have been filming a reality show about their life together, parted ways six months after becoming a couple in the first weeks of the ITV show. Dyer confirmed the pair’s split in a message posted to her Instagram story, in which she said they had realised their relationship was “not meant to be long term”. She added she and Fincham, 27, planned to stay friends and urged their fans to be understanding of the situation. Dani and Jack have broken up. pic.twitter.com/5hUl5iT7q0 — vic sanus...

content.title: Love Island's Jack and Dani Have Split Up – Why Do I Care So Friggin' Much? - HuffPost UK
content.desc: Dani Dyer confirmed it, quietly, on her Instagram stories, after a series of plugs for some sequinned tops from her Pretty Little Thing range. “It’s been an incredible 6 months, and we will always have a place in our hearts for each other, but sadly we’ve come to the realisation that it’s not meant to be longterm,” she wrote. And then the sign-off: “I hope you’ll all understand.” With that “all” (oh hell, it’s probably what did them in), Dani recognised that there were more than two people in her relationship with Jack Fincham. There were 4.1 million. And many of them are in mourning today....
